title: importing aol folders to thunderbird
content: Got new Win 11 computer. migrated all AOL to it. Had to reset my computer due to something i messed up. Now I got TB back on to receive and send emails but cant get my folders to TB. Have uninstalled several times, correct settings (verizon-aol email), have read many posts and articles and nothing works. I really want to import but aol is not listed in the import section. when I try to reconfigure it says "Incoming server already exists." TY
creator: chelma1

title: Strange - some folders open expanded but others do not and different each session!
content:
I am running Supernova version 115.5.2 and have a strange situation (maybe it's normal) when opening it.

If I have received any emails for any account in a previous session, then when I open a new session, the folders for these accounts open expanded and other accounts that did not receive any emails, remain collapsed.

I know there are others who have various issues regarding all folders expanded or collapsed but in Thunderbird before Supernova, I always collapsed all my folders and opened a new session with everything collapsed.

So can anyone tell me how to set-up Supernova so that when I collapse all my folders at the end of a session, a new session will open with all the folders still collapsed?

Thanks.
creator: Hawkeye58

title: I have Thunderbird installed on two computers and I cannot get TB to send emails.
content: I have Thunderbird installed on two computers and I cannot get TB to send emails. I can receive email but cannot send. My provider is Spectrum and I have gone to their website and filled in TB with Spectrums info but I still can't send. Do you have step by step instructions on properly filling in my information into TB? Thank you. Sam
creator: sam160

title: Deleted Messages showing up as read (old was Bug 1856993)
content:
The problem I had earlier with Thunderbird 115.5.2 and Charter/Spectrum iMap has gotten worse, it now happens time I log into the open folder regardless of the account or folder. If I compact, it just lessens the number of deleted or moved messages that reappear on its initial read of the inbox from the server. The messages that show up are marked as read and if I got to another account and then back, they disappear. If I stay within the same account, they stay regardless of the folder I go to, until I go to another account and back.

Compacting just minimizes what it sees, it does NOT cure the problem.
creator: gwestlun

title: Merge identical named folder contents
content:
I have many folders imported from an old Thunderbird installation into my current one.

All messages from that installation are in the 'Archives' folders but are the same names as my current installation: 

    Local Folders\Online Shopping\Ashampoo     Archives\2008\Online Shopping\Ashampoo

When I move Ashampoo folder in Archives to Local Folders, i'd like to be able to merge the contents automatically instead of Thunderbird offering to create a second folder with a number appended.

I have a lot of folders to process and my wrists are hurting already.
creator: Bangfeast

title: Trash folder
content:
How can I set my Trash folder to require manual emptying? (Windows 10, TB 115.5.2, 64-bit)

I like to keep the contents of my Trash folder until the end of the day, as I might need to refer to emails that I have put there earlier. I also enjoy the emptying the thing manually before I close the program at the end of the day, as it gives me the satisfaction of doing some cleaning without actually having to scrub a floor.

Unfortunately, the folder sometimes (not always) empties itself if we have a power failure, and it empties if I accidentally close the program, which is easier now with the new design, which I find a little hard to read.

I'd like to be able to set the Trash folder to keep its contents until I deliberately, with malice aforethought, set out to cause it to become empty through a decisive action on my part.

I have searched Thunderbird support, but I've not found a relevant article. Although I've used keywords from mt question above and tailored my search to the extent possible for TB 115, Windows 10, I've found only results that aren't relevant enough to be useful.
creator: AlphaCat

title: Errore invio email
content:
Buongiorno, sono a richiedere se possibile, un Vs. supporto per il seguente problema: sono alcuni giorni, che non riesco ad inviare email con Thunderbird (vers. 115.5.2 64 bit). Come server posta in uscita ho sempre usato Aruba. L'errore che viene ritornato è "non è stato possibile inviare il messaggio perchè la connessione col server smtps.aruba.it è scaduta", a volte invece oltre al questo messaggio indica anche che la connessione potrebbe essere stata rifiutata. Random, con estrema lentezza qualche email viene inviata. Ho provato a impostare come server posta uscita gmail, ma anche con questo ho lo stesso risultato. Ho provato a cancellare l'account e ricrearlo, ma senza esito. In ultimo ho scaricato e reinstallato thunderbird ma senza esito. Tramite webmail aruba le email vengono inviate. Stessa configurazione su PC dei colleghi, funziona tutto. Non so cosa controllare per risolvere il problema. Ringrazio per l'aiuto. Cordiali saluti

Daniele Griotti
creator: danielegriotti

content:
Adding a gmail account to Thunderbird. Thunderbird finds server settings OAuth2 start I see the screen where to log on. give it my password. I see the screen asking for the permissions, I click accept. It than jumps to a website I mannage. cant do anything here. exiting the screen, Thunderbird says login fails.

- password is ok - can login into webmail - changed password anyways - removed accound from Thunderbird and reinstalled (multiple times) - OAuth2 works for my @hotmail's - cookie's accepted - javascript active 

please help
creator: madadmin

title: Thunderbird Update forgets att.net email account password
content:
att.net email uses a "Secure Mail Key" authentication method... and it seems each time I allow Thunderbird to update itself, it 'loses' my att.net email password, forcing me to go back to att.net and start over, creating what AT&T calls "Secure Mail Keys".

My other email accounts (e.g., aol.com) don't have any issues following Thunderbird updates.

Is this a known issue with Thunderbird updates, somehow specific to 'secure mail keys'?

Windows: OS Name Microsoft Windows 11 Home Version 10.0.22621 Build 22621

Thunderbird: 115.5.2 (64-bit)

title: missing all message header buttons Reply, Forward, Delete, etc
content: About 2 days ago, all the message header buttons (Reply, Forward, Delete, etc) disappeared on just one of my Thunderbird accounts' Inbox. That account connects to a Microsoft Exchange Server email system via Exquilla. All of my other email accounts are "standard" (not using Exquilla add-on) and all of my other account Inboxes show the message header buttons when I click on a message header to see the full message in the lower message pane. Until about 2 days ago, all message header buttons appeared previously in all of my accounts (Exquilla-related or not). Since Exquilla was last updated more than 2 months ago, I tend to think that use of the Exquilla add-on is not the cause of this problem, but I include this info here to be as completely descriptive as possible. I am running Thunderbird 115.5.2 (64-bit), which Thunderbird "Help" informs me is "up to date".

content:
TB 115.5.2 (64bit) Win11 pc Avast Antivirus

Suddenly I started getting the error below for all of my 5 inboxes using the 32bit version of TB. I upgraded to the 64bit ver but problem still persists. I have a lot of important emails archived in local folders on TB and would sure like to recover them:

"Unable to open the summary file for Inbox on (email account). Perhaps there was an error on disk, or the full path is too long."

Does anyone have any thoughts that might help? Thanks in advance. Ross
creator: captainnice

title: msg filter not working on certain messages
content:
I'm using Thunderbird 45.7.1 under Win 7.

I want to tag some junk mail using "Body Contains" + a word cut & pasted from the message. The message looks the same displayed as Plain Text or Original HTML.

The filter is not working on these messages but does work on a copy I forwarded to myself. So, I checked the message source which says "Content-Type: text/plain; charset="ibm852"; Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit". The forwarded copy is "Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8; format=flowed; Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit".

I'm guessing the problem is the filter is not working on the ibm852 charset. Am I on the right track? How do I fix it?
creator: kitty21

title: Folder view, menu bar, and calendar time issues
content:
Since version 115.3.1 (64-bit) to present version 115.5.0 for Linux Mint (using Vertical View and Favorite Folders' 'only), the Compact Folder View is no longer compact at all. Each folder also includes my email address on each line making it take up 3x the space now. I can turn off the Compact View to actually get a more compact view, but this standard view shows a box with my email address above the folders, plus the folder tree. It was so clean looking before.

Is there no way to put the Menu Bar up top anymore? The very top bar is the customizable bar instead. It should be the other way around.

Most annoying is with the calendar when I put in an appointment or reservation for a future date, if I move timezones (I travel a lot), it changes the time with each timezone I pass through. For instance, if I make an appt for 11 am, it should be local time regardless of location. When I change timezones as I get closer to my appt location, it changes my appt to 12 noon, etc., potentially causing me to be late.
creator: deerpic

title: Thunderbird In The Taskbar
content: Hi Not sure if this is the right place to ask. I am using Thunderbird for my email program I have it pinned to the taskbar at the bottom of my computer screen. I was wondering if there is a way that when I have the mail screen open and I open another screen like Settings, or Account Settings, if they can be shown separately on the task bar, and not combing so only the tab I have open is showing. That way I can flip between each one a lot easier than clicking on the one showing and then having to select the next tab in the actual program itself. Thanks Marc
